strategy: Replace the gradient boosting model with a neural network (e.g., a multilayer perceptron) and use a deep learning approach with automatic feature learning. Instead of relying on handcrafted features, apply a combination of autoencoders to learn latent representations of the input features (Age, Fare, Pclass, etc.), followed by a classification head. Use dropout and batch normalization to prevent overfitting. For preprocessing, apply standardized scaling and encode categorical variables via one-hot encoding with target sampling to reduce cardinality. Train using early stopping on a validation set with stratified splits. This approach allows the model to capture non-linear interactions and complex patterns that traditional tree-based models may miss.
